page.title: 15Landscape around Chillington
page.content: I think that our landscape should carry on in the future and not be a litter bin because it is an area for nature to live in. The landscape has got rounded hills and soft rock (slate or shale). If you dug a hole you would first come to soil. The first soil you would come to would be red soil. It is red soil because of the iron in it. The most popular land cover is grass because it is easy to grow. I think the landscape is pretty. {The journey from Chillington to {Stokenham School. I walk out of my back door and go down the road. We go past the butcher's on the right hand side and the hairdresser, then the garage. Further up there's a telephone box. After the 'phone you go to Stokenham until you get to Carehouse Cross where you turn left to the school.
